title: U.S., South Korea agree to cooperate on space situational awareness for military purposes
summary: The SSA pact is part of a broader space security agreement reached between  John D. Hill, U.S. deputy assistant secretary of defense for space and missile defense, and Cho Yong-geun, the South Korean defense ministry’s director of North Korea policy, during the April 25 session of the Space Cooperation Working Group (SCWG) in Washington

title: Adranos, a startup that makes solid rocket motors, closes $20 million funding round
summary: Adranos, a startup that manufacturers solid rocket motors, announced April 26 it has closed a $20 million Series A funding round.

title: SpaceX rapidly turns around drone ship for sixth launch this month
summary: SpaceX has rapidly turned around one of its two East Coast ‘autonomous spaceport drone ships’ and sent the vessel back to sea...

title: PredaSAR nears first launch of its radar imaging constellation
summary: Radar imaging startup PredaSAR is preparing to deploy its first satellite on the SpaceX Transporter 6 rideshare, projected to launch in October.

title: NASA to repurpose OSIRIS-REx for second asteroid encounter
summary: A NASA mission to return samples from one near Earth asteroid will get an extended mission to visit a second asteroid under a plan approved by the agency April 25.

title: NRO plans for immediate and long-term acquisition of commercial satellite data
summary: The National Reconnaissance Office has issued contracts to satisfy immediate needs for commercial satellite data, while drafting requirements to bring commercial capabilities into an integrated architecture that includes classified U.S. government systems.

title: Artemis 1 vehicle heads back to VAB while NASA discusses what to do next
summary: NASA’s Artemis 1 flight vehicle is headed back to the Vehicle Assembly Building (VAB) at the Kennedy Space Center (KSC) after a month at Launch Pad 39B attempting to complete the final test before its first launch.

title: SpaceX Dragon returns private astronauts to Earth after an extra week in space
summary: Update: A SpaceX Crew Dragon has finally returned Axiom Space’s first crew of four private astronauts to Earth after recovery delays ultimately...

title: Vice Adm. Sharp: Commercial satellites a key counterforce to Russian disinformation
summary: Geospatial intelligence has been "instrumental to those fighting in Ukraine, and to shaping worldviews of the crisis,” said Vice Adm. Robert Sharp, director of the National Geospatial Intelligence Agency.

title: NASA Extends Exploration for 8 Planetary Science Missions
summary: Among the missions are InSight, Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter, Mars Odyssey, and Curiosity, all of which have been critical to expanding our understanding of the Red Planet.
